inn1.comm: back of a length and swinging in from a leg stump line. Hughes tries to work it away to the leg side but finds the fielder
shortish again as Hughes frees his arms to try and scythe this through point
piches it up a bit further as Hughes defends this leg stump line delivery to the leg side
fuller length delivery clipped behind square leg to fine leg
back of a length wide of off stump as Finch tries to get this away
back of a length that swings in to the batsman. Finch glances this in front of square on the leg side, but finds the fielder
133 kph, fuller length and shaping just in from outside off. Hughes looks to drive but ends up hitting this towards the leg side
137 kph, Shami pitches this in the slot and Hughes obliges with a lovely cover drive to the extra-cover boundary
138 kph, fire in just outside off on the full as Hughes punches this past the bowler for another boundary. Ideal start from the Australians as this outfield is looking very quick
144 kph, quicker ball which thuds into the front pad, but outside the line. Definitely getting some shape away from the batsman also
137 kph, back of a length outside off and shaping away as Hughes flashes at this straight to point
136 kph, fuller length delivery which shapes away upon landing. Allowed through to the keeper
fuller length just outside off, Finch stays back and pushes it towards cover
134 kph, back of a length which Finch gets on the back foot to defend
133 kph, slightly fuller as Finch plays off the back foot back to Bhuvi
132 kph, length ball outside off as Finch tries to free his arms and cut this away
133 kph, wide outside off as Finch flays at it with the ball carrying to third man, who fumbles it initially but is able to recover it well after the awkward bounce
133 kph, length ball pitching on middle and off which Hughes defend again on the back foot
137 kph, length ball which Finch gets forward to as the ball carries to short cover
138 kph, length ball going down the pads which Finch clips in front of square on the leg side
141 kph, beauty from Shami as he gets this to just beat the edge as it zips off the pitch. A little bit of shape away as well. Cracker of a delivery

136 kph, bowling a terrific length here as this one just beats the edge as Hughes is forced to play at it. The seam position has this just shaping away as it looks to be coming in. Just nips away every so slightly.
140 kph, length ball in the same channel which is duly defended to the off side
140 kph, fuller length delivery which Hughes gets down to as he tries to finesses this through point, but the fielder is aware and gets behind it comfortably
133 kph, back of a length which Finch gets behind to. Is fully aware of Dhoni just behind the stumps
131 kph, back of a length as Finch goes for a back foot punch but finds mid on straight away
133 kph, shortish length which Finch punches off the back foot. Dhawan makes a great dive to his right from mid on to stop some extra runs. Great effort there!
131 kph, length delivery on the pads which Hughes tries to work away
132 kph, pitched up a bit more on off stump as Hughes gets forward to try and find the gap
131 kph, length ball on middle and leg which Hughes fails to get away
140 kph, length ball clipped away just behind square for the third boundary of the innings
138 kph, consecutive boundaries for Finch as he glances this delivery straying to the leg side behind square which beats the boundary rider to the rope
137 kph, make that three in three as Finch just pushes this length ball on leg stump past a diving mid on to the boundary. The outfield is looking very quick here
137 kph, better line and length, this time outside off, as Finch punches this to the off side for one. Indian fans will breathe a silent sigh of relief
136 kph, length ball on middle and leg which Hughes is unable to get away
139 kph, length ball shaping away to the off as Hughes tries to squirt this behind square in the gap between point and third man
134 kph, short delivery on middle and off which Finch gets back to as he punches through back to the bowler
132 kph, short again as Finch is able to work this away through midwicket for one
134 kph, one of the stranger shots you will see as Hughes plays an improvised short arm pull to a delivery which kept rather low, with a rather extravagant follow through

132 kph, shortish delivery which Hughes tries to pull away but ends up hitting this sweetly to Virat Kohli stationed at square leg, who makes an excellent dive to his left to hold on to the chance. Excellent fielding which has resulted in the loss of an early wicket for Australia.
136 kph, gets this length ball to shape away as Watson follows this delivery, but luckily avoids the edge
133 kph, pitched up a bit further as Watson is able to work this away to the off side
137 kph, fuller length delivery outside off which Watson plants his front foot to as he looks to drive through the line
140 kph, length ball shaping in as the ball thuds into the pad. The Indians go up but this was missing the line
139 kph, similar delivery which Watson gets forward to in defence
134 kph, length ball which Watson drives solidly, but back to the bowler who gets a hand on it
139 kph, back of a length delivery which Watson punches to the cover
136 kph, length ball on middle which Watson on drives straight to the fielder stationed at mid on
132 kph, shortish delivery which Finch tucks away to the leg side
132 kph, back of a length outside off which Watson drives to mid off

132 kph, length ball straying down the pads as Watson is able to clip this away and place it well enough to beat the incoming fielder at square leg to the midwicket boundary. Told you the outfield was lightning
135 kph, length ball that Watson gets down to and pulls, almost a short-arm type, to midwicket
132 kph, length ball going down the leg side as Finch is unlucky to work this away
133 kph, back of a length on off stump as Finch gets back to in defence

length ball on middle stump which is immediately called no-ball. Reason why? Well its because silly mid on had a foot on the bowling pitch at the time of the release of the ball, Suresh Raina being the guilty party
137 kph, fuller length delivery which Watson leans into for a drive
138 kph, length ball on middle which Finch tries to work away to the leg side
138 kph, gives just enough length for Watson to slash at this hard enough behind square to beat third man to the boundary
136 kph, good length ball on middle and off which Watson gets forward to

137 kph, fuller length ball which Watson drives, right at silly mid on, who fails to get a good grasp on it, as it continues through his legs to mid on. Makes you scratch your head as to what's the point of it all?
87 kph, flighted on off and straightening with Finch forward in defence
86 kph, length ball again as it hits the front pad of Finch, who tries to advance down the wicket
88 kph, pitched up on off which Finch defends again
91 kph, darted in again on the same line as Finch walks down but fails to get bat on it
93 kph, length ball again which Finch is finally able to squirt away to the off side
95 kph, fired in on middle which Watson gets forward to in defence

86 kph, length ball pitching on middle as Ashwin, who is coming round the wicket, breaches Finch's defences as he goes for an improvised flick, but fails to get bat on it. Ball castles into the stumps, and its two down now for the Australians
Bailey defends this first ball with ease through the off side
84 kph, Bailey gets forward in defense to this length ball from Ashwin
81 kph, Bailey prods at this one as it carries harmlessly to the off side
83 kph, loopy delivery on middle which Bailey tries to work away to the leg side
86 kph, length ball on middle and off which Bailey works away square of the wicket
91 kph, Bailey gets forward to defend this Jadeja delivery that straightens on off stump
92 kph, almost a carbon copy of the previous delivery, with the same result
92 kph, gets a little bit of width to work with as he cuts this away to sweeper cover
93 kph, back of a length on off stump and straightening. Watson fails to push this through the off side
93 kph, length ball again which Watson is able to squeeze away to the off side
91 kph, darted on middle as Watson goes for the drive through to long on
85 kph, pitched on middle and turning in. Worked away to midwicket
89 kph, length ball again which Watson tries to work away
93 kph, Watson fails to find the gap on the leg side
86 kph, Watson gets down the track to clip this through to long on
81 kph, pitched up in the blockhole and defended back to the bowler
81 kph, back of a length as Watson gets deep in his crease to try and push this through midwicket
fuller length delivery on and around off which Bailey drives through mid off
with some width to offer Watson stays on the back foot to cut this away behind square in the gap for a much-needed boundary
92 kph, better line from Jadeja as Watson fails to get this away
92 kph, length ball on off stump as Watson tries to drive this through the off side
93 kph, some slack fielding from the Indians as Dhoni shows his discontent at Shami's fielding coming in from the deep.
92 kph, better line which Watson is unable to get away to the leg side
91 kph, length ball which Bailey gets on the back foot to work away
93 kph, pitching on middle and off as Watson gets forward to defend
90 kph, a mistimed slop from Watson, who is trying to direct this through midwicket, ends up getitng an inside edge and carrying through fine leg for a fortuitous boundary

more in control this time from Watson, but again the Indians are guilty of being complacent in the field as Jadeja, who is at deep midwicket, takes his time with the throw, affording Australia the extra run
91 kph, darted in on middle and leg and thudding into the upper left thigh of Watson as he goes for the short-arm pull. There is an appeal, but the umpire is having none of it
Watson tucks this middle stump delivery to the leg side for none
88 kph, fuller length outside off which Bailey is able to eke out in front of point, and Yuvraj diving to his right to get a hand on it. But Bailey still able to sneak a couple
89 kph, fired in on middle which Bailey hits back at Jadeja
90 kph, pitched up as Bailey is able to guide this through the off side for one

92 kph, Watson, looking to go over midwicket, ends up spooning this up through mid off, with Rohit Sharma taking a straight forward catch. But hang on. Looks like the umpire has called back Watson to the wicket as they refer the decision to third umpire. And the news all of India don't want to hear has just occurred as it looks as if he did in fact go over just slightly. So it's a front foot no-ball, and a free hit for the Australian batsmen. Tough times indeed
low full toss which Bailey swats at straight to deep midwicket, who takes the catch, but of course, the wicket doesn't count. Two catches and not a wicket to show..
91 kph, fired in on middle and off which Watson attempts a drive at
Watson is resolute in defense to this delivery that is pitched on off stump
81 kph, pitched up and just outside off as it turns away from the batsman
85 kph, leg side delivery which Watson is able to clip away
75 kph, well flighted and deceived in the air as Bailey plays for the turn, but the trajectory is just so sharp
82 kph, flighted again on middle as Bailey drives this straight at cover
80 kph, pitching on middle and leg with Bailey covering the line for the turn
81 kph, Bailey gets on the back foot to push this through long on for a single
pushes it through wide outside off and it was flatter too, the batsman goes back and waits for it, before slapping it through backward point
this one turns in a touch into the batsman, who goes back and defends it to off
tossed up delivery on off, the batsman pulls out a slog sweep and whacks it firmly, but there is a fielder at deep midwicket
on the pads, Watson flicks it straight to backward square leg
he drives it firmly to midwicket where the fielder makes a good half-stop
he comes out of the crease but the bowlers pushes it a touch wide outside off, the batsman has to adjust late and defend
lots of air from Mishra on this one, the batsman wanted to drive it straight down the ground, but he gets an inside edge on to the pads
he keeps tossing it up on the middle stump line, Watson defends off the front foot
this outfield is too quick, the batsman takes a step down the pitch and slices the tossed up delivery to deep extra cover, without any timing, but the ball still beats the fielder to the boundary
how did this miss the off stump! It was flatter this time and it turned past the batsman's bat, and somehow missed the off stick
fuller length delivery is eased to long off for a single
he takes a forward step and defends the tossed up delivery to cover
bowls a flatter delivery on the middle stump line, the batsman defends it from the crease
he flicks this one to deep midwicket and calls for a second as the fielder has to come around to cover that one
tossed up and slower, it's wide outside off, Watson goes for a slog sweep, but gets an inside edge towards deep square leg where a misfield by Yuvraj allows an extra run
he takes a forward step and defends the flighted delivery
this time he is beaten by a skiddy delivery outside off,Watson was looking to play it late
tossed up and fuller outside off, the batsman takes a forward stride and defends it solidly
here comes the googly, the batsmen didn't read that at all, he was looking to punch it through cover, but it misses the edge
this one is pushes comfortably to long on for a single
tossed up on leg stump line, the batsman comes forward and defends
slower and tossed up on the stumps, the batsman comes out of the crease and pushes it towards mid-off
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman drives it firmly down the ground to long on
this one breaks away after pitching on leg, but Bailey defends it off the back foot
he comes out of the crease and takes it on the full to drive it down to long on
on he comes out of the crease and lofts it sweetly over mid-off with an inside out drive
more good use of the feet and this one has even better result to it, it lands on the sight screen this time. Australia hit the 100 mark
he goes deep into the crease and whips it off his pads to deep square leg for a single
he was shaping for that slap over deep midwicket, but the length was not right, so Watson checks his shot at the last moment
bowler's response is to bowl the carrom-ball, but this one is down the leg side
another carrom-ball, this one turns a touch too, but Watson had taken a huge forward stride to defend that to the leg side

oh this one almost carries to the man at long-off! Drops a metre short of him! There was a lot of flight on this one and the batsman went for the big hit over the fielder at long-off, but didn't time it at all
another big leg break outside off, but the pace was slow, which allows the batsman to go back and punch it to long off
so much air that it doesn't land on the pitch, and Watson needs no invitation, he nonchalantly whacks it over deep midwicket for a six
he tries to play the forceful sweep to a delivery wide outside off and is beaten
short this time from Mishra, he is lucky as the batsman punches it straight to deep cover off the back foot
tossed up and full on off, Watson presses forward and defends to cover
oh this is beautifully placed! It was flatter and on the stumps, Watson goes deep in the crease and opens the face of the bat late to beat the man backward point
fires this one on the leg stump line, the batsman defends it down the pitch
he goes on the back foot to punch it to long on for a single that brings his half-century
now Bailey eases it to long-off from the back foot to pick up single
it's in Watson's arc - a big arc it is - and no ground is big enough when he starts hitting these shots! He takes a forward step and slaps the straight delivery over long-on
a beautiful googly again, Bailey was looking to push it to the off side and was surprised as it came in, defends belatedly
flatter delivery on the pads, the batsman goes back and pushes it firmly to deep midwicket for a couple
he stays in the crease and slaps it to deep point for a single
he is really opening up now! This wasn't hit that well at all, more of a slice, but Watson manages to hit it straight towards the sight screen. The ball just tips over the rope
now Mishra tries a little variation, something of an offspinner, but this one is cut to deep point off the back foot
he is being taken apart, Mishra tosses it up and it's full enough for the batsman to get under it and whack it to the gap at deep midwicket
flatter delivery on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends it back down the pitch
quicker and fuller on the middle stump line, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
slower this time and Watson defends it to midwicket
he dabs it to the gap at square leg for an easy single
he goes deep in the crease and turns the length delivery softly in the gap at deep square leg for a quick couple
tossed up and full, the batsman drives it off the front foot to deep extra cover for another couple
he flights this one wide down the leg side, the batsman sweeps it, but hits it straight to short fine leg
here comes the gift. A short delivery - attempted carrom ball - allows the batsman enough time to whack it to deep square leg boundary
another attempted carrom ball, but this one is down the leg side and the batsman lets it go to earn his bonus
quicker delivery on off, the batsman slaps it back to the bowler who makes a half stop
he goes back and punches this towards extra cover, where Yuvraj makes a terrible attempt - allows the ball to go through his legs - and the batsmen pick up three
tossed up delivery on the pads, the batsman gets down on his knee and sweeps it powerfully to fine leg
he goes on the back foot to a flatter delivery and nudges it fine on the leg side for a single
full delivery outside off, the batsman easily drives it to wide long off for a single
full and loopy outside off, Watson bludgeons it to long on for a single
the batsman comes forward and drives it comfortably for a single to long off
quicker length delivery on off stump, bowled from wide of the crease, the batsman just plants his front foot out and drives it to long off
this one was a touch slower, the batsman dabs it to  point off the back foot
and Bailey continues his golden run, getting to another half-century, without anyone realising it. It was a full delivery and he eased it to long off
he makes room to a full delivery and drives it, but hits it straight to cover
oh keep running after that, you are not going to catch it Mishra! Bailey goes deep to a short delivery and cuts it late to find the boundary
tossed up delivery on off, easily pushed to long off for a single
he tries a big slog sweep to one that is flighted wide outside off, gets an inside edge to deep midwicket
oh that has been hit with some power by Bailey! It was short outside off and Bailey quickly transferred the weight to back foot and hammered it to cow corner
another flatter delivery, Bailey picks up a single to midwicket
tossed up and full on the stumps, the batsman drives it to long on
he goes deep in the crease to a length delivery, but punches it straight to cover
tosses it up on the leg stump, gets it to break away a touch too, Watson defends off the back foot
quicker and shorter outside off, Watson wanted to find that boundary at deep point, but he hits it straight to the fielder at backward point
this one is down the leg side and it flicks it to short fine leg for a single
the sixers are raining here! slightly short by Mishra and Bailey takes full toll! He goes back in the crease and pulls it over cow corner.
fuller and wider outside off, Watson pushes it to long off for a single
oh, what was that! Bailey wanted to send it outside the ground, but the ball stops on him, hits the toe-end and stays on the pitch

he will get there this time as he gets a short one from Virat - who is not Mitchell Johnson - and Bailey whacks it to the cow corner area, it hits the boundary skirting flush. The replays showed that it might have fallen just inside the boundary
another powerful mow to deep midwicket by Watson to a full delivery
against the run of play, Virat manages to beat the batsman with a length delivery as Bailey looks to cut it late
full and loopy outside off, Watson comes forward and drives it with enough force to beat the man at extra cover. Jadeja at long off had no chance to stop that
fuller and quicker on stumps, Bailey is a touch late to come forward and gets an inside edge to square leg
full on the middle stump line, the batsman comes forward and dabs it to midwicket for a single
he drives this one straight to the man at cover
he steps out of the crease and calmly pushes the length delivery to deep cover for a single
the batsman punches this one firmly to deep midwicket for a single
he stays patient and defend the full delivery to cover
bowls a spitting leg break, but it's slow and short, the batsman waits and has all the time in the world to send it screaming to the extra cover boundary
now this one is full and flighted, the batsman gets to its pitch and pings it just over the bowler's head. Stop that. Anyone? No
bowls a flatter delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends off the back foot
he takes a tiny step out of the crease and drives the full delivery to long on
tossed up delivery on off, the batsman dabs it to point off the front foot
this one is quicker for Mishra, 83.2 kph, and breaks away slightly after pitching, it beats the outside edge too
he gets a full delivery on off, the batsman just easily creams it straight down towards mid-off, where Dhawan dives over the ball
this one is past the left-hand side of Dhawan, no power, just timing this time! It was not a full delivery, but Watson just places it in the gap at wide mid-off

make it three in three! Watson arrives at the century pedestal - the first Aussie in this series to get there. It was a full toss on the pads and all he had to do was to flick it to deep backward square leg boundary. How much is India going to rue that missed chance! This isn't over

oh Shami roars as he splatter the stumps with an inducker! Watson has to go straight after getting to his 100. It was a length delivery and came back in. Watson was looking to drive it down the ground on the up, but it missed the inside edge to hit off and middle.
full delivery on off, the batsman drives his first delivery to the man at cover point
gets some inward movement again from a length, Maxwell defends it solidly
tosses it up on the stumps, the batsman drives it to long on
slower and on the pads, the batsman has to wait before nudging it to deep backward square leg
on the leg stump line again, the batsman clips it to deep backward square leg
he doesn't wait, it's the reverse sweep taking the ball from well outside leg to hit it through backward point
oh this one is even better! Ashwin fires it full on off and the batsman flicks it over the short third man fielder

excellent catch in the deep by bhuvneshwar! Ashwin had changed the line to off, but that wasn't going to make much difference for Maxwell. He went deep in the crease spotting the shortness of length and swung his hammer aiming for the deep midwicket stand. But Bhuvneshwar keeps his composure at the boundary pulling off a well-judged one catch. He punches the air. Ashwin takes a gasp..
short and wide from Bhuvneshwar, Voges chops it down towards third man for a single
131 kph, length ball on off as Bailey gets forward to defend
126 kph, length ball outside off and Bailey just caresses this behind point through third man for a boundary
132 kph, length ball angling in as Bailey defends it back to the bowler
130 kph, same line and length with Bailey angling his bat to carve this through third man for a single and retain the strike
88 kph, pitched on middle with the ball turning in sharply. Hits the front pad as Ashwin goes up for the appeal. This looks like it may have just missing, if not clipping leg stump
flighted in on middle which is defended carefully by the batsman
flighted just outside off and turned to mid on for a single
length ball on middle as Bailey is able to tuck it away to midwicket and runs hard enough for the pair to complete two
length ball on middle and defended back to the bowler
pitched on middle and leg which Bailey defends resolutely
131 kph, fuller length outside off which is defended back to Bhuvi
131 kph, length ball which Voges gets behind comfortably
110 kph, slower ball as Voges leans forward to drive to cover for one
127 kph, length ball outside off as Bailey gets on the back foot to pull this fiercely in front of square to the midwicket boundary, beating square leg to the rope
119 kph, slow again and Bailey has all the time in the world to punish this wide delivery through the gap in cover for yet another four

131 kph, length ball outside off as Bailey carves this behind square, with the ball racing away from Mishra, who is stationed at third man, to the boundary. That's the third boundary of the over and Bailey is now into the 90s
84 kph, Voges gets forward to defend this length ball outside off
83 kph, Voges tries to tuck this away to the leg side for one, but Ashwin dives to stop the extra
once again defended to the leg side without too much fuss
shorter this time as Voges gets back to pull this through midwicket
pitched up just outside off as Bailey hits this back at the bowler
pitched just outside off as Bailey drives this through extra-cover, with the fielders slow after the ball. The pair are able to scamper three runs without too much trouble. Bailey now on 99
short ball which Bailey gets back to and pulls through to square leg. Takes the run to bring up his 2nd ODI hundred off just 84 balls. Fantastic effort!
86 kph, length ball which Voges tries to work away
short from Raina as Voges gets on the back toot to try and steer this behind square
able to turn this away to the leg side for one
advances down the track to try and steer this through midwicket
able to glance this quicker one down the leg side to square leg
steers this length delivery off the back foot to long on
length ball outside off which Bailey jumps down to and drives through extra-cover
length ball outside off and turns away, beating the outside edge
gets this one to drift a bit as Voges gets forward to defend
Voges able to guide this length ball through to long on for a single
shortish delivery which Bailey plays off the back foot to the same area
darts this on middle as Bailey tries to steer it away
Voges dances down and hammers this over midwicket for a lofted boundary
on middle and tucked away to the leg side
Bailey is certainly looking to get a move on as he steps down and hits this cleanly over the long on boundary for a huge six
Bailey able to steer this past Raina to the leg side for a single
length ball that spins sharply away from Bailey as he struggles to get bat on ball
back of a length again, staying low, as Bailey smashes this over the midwicket boundary, just clearing the rope
similar delivery as before as Bailey cuts it away in front of square
slips in the google outside off as Voges goes for the cut behind square
short again and on middle as Voges powers this through the gap at midwicket for a boundary
Voges able to steer this through midwicket for a couple. Some rather lax fielding by the Indians here
much better from Mohammed Shami, attempts the yorker, ends up as a low full toss, driven towards long on for a single
136 kph, low full toss on middle which Voges steers to long on
136 kph, darted on middle as Bailey bludgeons this down the ground for a boundary
much better from Shami, gets his yorker right, Bailey digs it out towards cover for a single
133 kph, yorker on middle as Voges digs it out successfully
132 kph, length ball on middle which Voges hammers through midwicket for another boundary
no need to respect the bowler, Bailey gets down on one knee and plays a slog sweep that just sails over the midwicket boundary for a huge six
this time goes for a reverse sweep to a full delivery on leg and middle, but finds short third man
length ball on middle as Voges steps back and cuts away square on the off side
back of a length and straightening as Voges pushes this off the back foot to cover
length ball which Bailey steers through to extra-cover
darted in on middle as Bailey carves this behind point for a single
135 kph, low full toss ans Bailey obliges with a six over long on. It wasn't even that sweetly timed, but Bailey able to muscle it over
120 kph, slower ball , fuller length delivery smashed through extra-cover
133 kph, shortish delivery which Bailey hits through the line over midwicket. Long on running in but unable to deflect the ball away from the boundary
length ball which Bailey backs away too and smashes over extra-cover
Voges slaps this away to the off side to get the captain back on strike
121 kph, slower ball as Bailey fails to get a bat on it, swinging quite early through the line
Voges able to tuck this away to long on for a single
darted in on middle as Bailey is able to get this away to long on
dances down the track and strikes this sweetly straight down the ground, with Rohit Sharma, stationed at long on, unable to stop it as he goes in for a sloppy slide
flighted low toss which Voges tries to sweep powerfully, but finds deep midwicket
back of a length and Bailey able to cut this away through cover. Brings up his 150 in style as well
Bailey retains the strike with a single square of the wicket
126 kph, yorker on off stump as Bailey squirts it away to the off side
length ball which Voges pulls behind square to beat fine leg to the boundary
length ball again as Voges powers this tot long on
yorker length on middle as Bailey goes for a scoop behind to fine leg, but unable to get good bat on it
right in the blockhole as Bailey digs it out successfully
Voges waits on this full delivery before playing a lofted straight drive down the ground which finds the fielder
Voges dances down the track and goes for the swat, with the ball redirecting to long on
Bailey's wonderful innings comes to an end in the pursuit of quick runs as he smashes this Jadeja offering right to long off, who takes a simple catch. Awesome performance from the Australia captain

and would you believe it, Voges goes too. As the batsman crossed, Voges was on strike, and he ends up taking this length ball and accidentally hitting it straight back at the bowler with the bottom end of the pitch. And would you seriously believe it. Jadeja has over-stepped YET again. It will be a free-hit for Australia, and Voges is trudging back, almost in disbelief. Dhoni must be infuriated under those awesome glasses of his.
not too much damage with the free hit as it ends up being hit over to midwicket

fuller length ball just outside off which Johnson gets down on one knee to slog, but finds Dhawan stationed at deep midwicket. Will the umpires check the front foot no-ball too? Looks like the umpires will have spared him the embarrassment just for now. Wickets beginning to fall in a heap, but it doesn't really matter with 346 on the board
able to steer this length ball on middle through extra-cover for a quick two runs
goes for the swipe but hits this behind square on the leg side as Australia finish off their innings on an excellent score of 350 for 6
pushed through by Jadeja, Voges works it behind square for a single

inn2.comm: 139 kph, and India are off to a bang as Rohit Sharma is able to drive this in the gap between cover and point to get the chase off in the best way possible
139 kph, fuller length and swinging in as Rohit gets bat on ball
148 kph, solid bat presented to a fuller length ball as this carries to cover on the 30-yard circle
146 kph, full again as Rohit goes for the booming drive, but hits it straight at point. It looked sweetly timed off the bat, just failed to penetrate the gap
150 kph, back of a length ball which Rohit gets on top off without too much difficult. But a good change-up nonetheless from Johnson
152 kph, drags this one just a bit on the leg side as it gains appreciable bounce behind leg stump and over to the keeper. Quick stuff already from the Australian
149 kph, Rohit gets behind this length ball as it travels through mid off to the fielder
128 kph, length ball slightly shaping away as Dhawan advances to defend this to the off side
131 kph, almost back of a length on middle as the ball crashes into the front pad. McKay is adamant in his appeal, but the umpire is not interested
132 kph, splays this down the leg side as it is clear that the Australians are not giving any width to the southpaw
134 kph, pitching on a good length just outside off as Dhawan shuffles down to pierce the gap between cover and mid off
129 kph, great line just outside off as Rohit prods forward cautiously, hanging his bat, with the ball rushing past the outside edge
131 kph, slight shape away upon pitching at a length as Rohit seemingly goes after it, but doesn't follow through
130 kph, length ball on off as Rohit advances forward to defend
145 kph, pitched up on the pads and Dhawan does the needful as he flicks it through the gap between mid on and square leg to the midwicket boundary
148 kph, pitches this up further on off as Dhawan defends this tentatively to the leg side
146 kph, toe-crusher from Johnson as Dhawan does well enough to angle his bat to get this away, almost all the way, to deep midwicket for a couple. Fantastic cricket all around
152 kph, another wide down the leg side from Johnson as this one begins to rise after pitching
145 kph, Johnson struggling with his line here as this time he gets it outside the off side, and almost to first slip. Steve Harmison Ashes 2006-07 references anyone?
150 kph, this one angles in sharply to the batsman at a length as Rohit does well to cover the line
149 kph, length ball again, but this time slipping down the leg side, as Rohit helps it through to fine leg
back of a length delivery which angles past the batsman on the way to the keeper
129 kph, fuller length delivery outside off which is directed straight to silly mid off
131 kph, length ball brought in closer as Rohit tries to tuck this away to mid on
129 kph, lovely languid stroke from Rohit behind square on the off side as he angles this to third man
132 kph, fuller length ball which Dhawan gets forward to defend
131 kph, tucked away behind square leg for a single to get Rohit on strike
132 kph, length ball outside off as Rohit cuts it away on the off side
144 kph, angled in again on middle as Rohit is solid in defence
146 kph, slanted in to Rohit who continues to show how good his front foot defence is
146 kph, spotting the length being a bit shorter and goes for the lofted extra-cover shot which carries all the way to the boundary
149 kph, slightly fuller this time as Rohit gets behind line
135 kph, the supposed slower ball has been unleashed, and Rohit leans into the drive to guide this through mid off for a couple
149 kph, finishes off the over with a booming cover drive, that doesn't boom too loud as it gets snuffed out by a vigilant cover fielder
133 kph, good length ball on middle as Dhawan thinks about getting down the pitch to it, but ends up hitting it back to the bowler
130 kph, advances down again to this full length, almost overpitched ball as Dhawan squirts this away on the leg side
130 kph, shortish delivery on off as Rohit carves this behind point to third man
132 kph, length ball on middle which Dhawan tries to get away on the off side
131 kph, length ball and Dhawan is struggling to get McKay away as he tries to work it again to the leg side
131 kph, excellent length again from McKay as Dhawan shuffles down to direct this through mid off for a single, and retain the strike
133 kph, Rohit defends this length ball on the front foot
131 kph, same result as Rohit looks to keen to work himself in
133 kph, slightly fuller this time from Faulkner as Rohit is able to steer this behind point for one
135 kph, length ball which Dhawan defends without too much trouble
134 kph, length ball which Dhawan drives through extra-cover, with mid off doing well to stop the ball
137 kph, length ball that just comes in as Rohit gets forward to defend
130 kph, back of a length on leg which Dhawan tries to flick away, but fails to get meaningful connection
131 kph, length ball going past off which Dhawan waits on as he angles the bat to pick the gap on the off side
133 kph, fuller length ball which Rohit tries to tuck away to the leg side
130 kph, shortish delivery which Dhawan meets with the full face of the bat to push just to the right of the bowler down to mid on
132 kph, length ball outside off which Rohit carves behind point, but finds the fielder once again
132 kph, back of a length on middle and off which Dhawan gets down to cut away
132 kph, Dhawan steps down to this length ball to pick the gap on the off side
137 kph, fuller length just outside off and defended to the off side
138 kph, length ball that Rohit steps down to and directs square of the wicket
133 kph, Dhawan unable to get him away despite advancing down the wicket
134 kph, dropped Dhawan cuts this away behind square, with Maxwell, stationed at backward point, unable to hold on to a catch coming at a good height. Big miss there from Australia.
good length ball angling in, Sharma gets forward and misses the flick as he is hit on the pads
132 kph, great length again as Dhawan cuts this away to the off side
131 kph, and the first boundary for a while from India as Rohit flashes hard at this wide delivery from McKay to find the square boundary
133 kph, Rohit hits this inside-out over extra-cover with a lofted shot as it looks as if the time has come for India to open up
132 kph, beautiful length which seams in and clips the front pad. McKay again goes up but it looks as if height is an issue here.
131 kph, Dhawan knows what to expect as this straddles a leg stump line which he simply swivels and helps it through to the fine leg boundary
130 kph, Dhawan unable to work away this length ball outside off
136 kph, length ball angling in which Rohit gets forward to and defends
131 kph, a little bit of width on offer as Rohit is able to squeeze this behind point for one
136 kph, lovely timed back cut by Dhawan that beats backward point to the third man boundary
135 kph, squirts this away to the off side on the front foot
135 kph, length ball angling in as Rohit is able to ease this behind square
136 kph, Dhawan advances down to drive this, although not sweetly, to extra-cover
87 kph, flighted on a length and staying low. Dhawan goes for the back cut but misses it entirely. Seems to over balance, but he is in the crease
91 kph, getitng a bit of turn as this one holds it line, almost stopping on Dhawan there as he defends
94 kph, Dhawan eases this length ball to long on for a single
91 kph, flighted on a length outside off as Rohit is resolute in defence
89 kph, Rohit able to steer this through to mid off
88 kph, turned to the leg side by Dhawan for a single
128 kph, Watson called no-ball and looks slightly incredulous. Turns out it was a back foot no-ball so free hit called
136 kph, pitched straight up outside off with Maxwell making a dive to his left to take a stunning catch at point off a Rohit drive, albeit without any detriment to the batting side
136 kph, lovely, straight bat from Rohit that travels just to the right of the bowler, with mid on making an excellent stop
137 kph, this one going down the pads as Rohit helps it along to fine leg
134 kph, Dhawan unleashes an expansive cover drive which travels all the way through to deep extra-cover
139 kph, bouncer which is dealt with by Dhawan quite efficiently as he pulls it through to fine leg
132 kph, length ball which Rohit defends on the front foot
98 kph, Dhawan ekes this away to the off side
88 kph, Dhawan looking to guide this through the leg side
92 kph, Dhawan ends up defending this back to the bowler
flighted delivery on off, Dhawan comes on the front foot and defends it back to the bowler
floated delivery that skids on, Dhawan looks to work it on the leg-side and gets a leading edge back to the bowler
drifts this on leg stump, Dhawan gets on his knee and sweeps it to long leg for only a single. Good over from Doherty, just a single coming from that
136 kph, Dhawan able to glide this back of a length delivery to third man for a single
138 kph, going down the pads as Rohit tries to work it away
127 kph, full and just outside off as Dhawan looks for the drive, but to no avail
136 kph, Watson spears this in on middle which Dhawan just clips off his pads as the ball sizzles over midwicket to the boundary
136 kph, Dhawan starting to play assuredly here as he drives this through cover
134 kph, length ball on the leg stump which Rohit flicks away behind square
he bowls a floater on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends
he steps out of the crease and is beaten by the arm-ball, gets hit on the pads. Doherty appeals, but that was probably heading down leg
the batsman takes a forward stride and turns the flighted delivery to fine leg for a single
good tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman takes a forward step and drives it straight to point
tossed up and fuller on the stumps, Rohit drives it in the air towards long off
he bowls this really slow, the batsman comes forward, but then has to wait. He tucks it straight to square-leg
he bowls a length delivery on the pads, which is calmly flicked away to deep midwicket
oh he just survives again as this sliced shot just lands behind a flying Maxwell at point! He charged down the pitch, but didn't get hold of his shot, it just eluded the fielder there
this time he stays in the crease and creates pace behind the ball with smashing bat speed, it flies past the left hand side of Maxwell this time, but he had no chance. Fifty for Dhawan
he bowls length at 124 kph on off, the batsman comes forward and defends it to cover
goes full on off stump and Dhawan responds by playing a forceful off drive, but that's hit straight to the man at short cover
slows down the pace on this back of length delivery, the batsman was already forward by the time it arrives, he defends down the pitch
pushed through, but this is heading down the leg side, Rohit paddles it to fine leg for an easy single
slower this time, but Dhawan spots the pace and length early, he goes down on his knees and sweeps it powerfully to the deep square leg boundary
Doherty floats this one outside off, the batsman comes forward and drives it to long off for a single
slower and on a length, Rohit presses forward and defends
he steps out of the crease, but Doherty shortens his length in response. Rohit defends it towards covers
another good delivery on off stump, Rohit manages to push it to cover point

oh was that another drop! Oh yes, another drop, a very hard chance though, by Finch at cover. It was a slow tossed up delivery on off, the batsman drove it in the air, Finch flung to his right, but couldn't hold on
waits in the crease and defends down the pitch
he pushes this one to long off for a single
full and flighted on off, the batsman defends it to cover
he slows down the pace this time, the batsman reaches forward and defends
pushed through this time, Rohit goes on the back foot to punch it to long-off. It brings up India's 100 too
another flatter delivery for Rohit, who goes on the back foot and picks up a single to long off
tossed up and full outside off, the batsman comes forward and then opens the face slightly to run it down fine on the off side
pushed through on the pads and Dhawan doesn't miss his chance, he paddles this one through the right of the short fine leg fielder. On this outfield, that's enough
steps out of the crease but Doherty pulls his length back, Dhawan has to defend
tries to beat the man at short third man with a reverse sweep, but he hits it straight to the man
this time he waits in the crease and picks the slight shortness in length early to cut it late between short third man and backward point
slower tossed up delivery on leg stump line, the batsman gets hit on the pads as he misses his flick
this time he comes forward to dab it towards cover for a quick single
they think about a couple after Dhawan drives a full delivery to wide long on, but they decide against it as fielder gets there quickly
he comes down the pitch and chips the full delivery towards long on for a single
pushed through on off, the batsman dabs it towards cover for a quick single
he tries to pierce that gap behind point with a late cut, but isn't able to beat the fielder
he starts off with a back of length delivery outside off that Dhawan crunches to deep point off the front foot
cramps the batsman for room with a back of length delivery, Rohit defends it down the pitch
he attempts a full, slow, wide delivery, and Rohit was almost beaten by the pace as he stretched to reach that, but he gets a thick outside edge that runs to the third man boundary
he waits in the crease and steers the length delivery down to third man for a single

this is beautifully played by Dhawan! there was no room to play this back of length delivery, but Dhawan creates some by arching back and then he guides it from where a first slip would have been. It beats the third man fielder easily
that last delivery makes MJ pitch it fuller this time, but Dhawan was ready for that, he creams it through cover and the ball races to the boundary
he flights it on the middle stump line, the batsman reaches forward and defends
more runs, Rohit steps out of the crease, which forces Maxwell to bowl it short and wide. It's easily slapped to deep point boundary after that
steps out again, but this time he is not to the pitch of the ball, pushes it through midwicket
he comes forward and punches it to mid-off
he gets it to turn and bounce of a shorter length, and it surprises Dhawan after he had stepped out
tries to cut this one through off, but gets an inside edge past the stumps to short fine leg
fires a short of length delivery on the body which Rohit guides to third man with ease
oh he loses his direction here, it was a 152 kph missile, but down the leg side
he tests Dhawan with a short ball on the body, but the batsman is able to pull it to fine leg comfortably
back of length delivery on the body at 152 kph, Rohit defends it towards midwicket
bowls a slower bouncer this time and the lack of speed messes with Rohit's attempt to guide it to third man, he is beaten
keeps bowling that short of length stuff, but this time it's heading down the leg side and Rohit helps it on its way down to fine-leg boundary to bring up his half-century
another slower bouncer, but Rohit was waiting for that and he pulls it firmly to deep backward square leg
he waits in the crease for this length delivery and then punches it to long off for a single
not short enough, but Dhawan goes on the back foot and plays a cracking cut shot, put straight to point
this time he goes in the other direction, pulling a similar delivery towards the cow corner
full and flighted this time, the batsman comes forward and defends
he waits in the crease and cuts it late to the fielder at point
he takes a forward stride and works the full delivery to behind square on the leg side
he bowls it flatter outside off, Dhawan cuts it straight to backward point
he takes a forward step and nudges the full delivery towards square leg for a single
flatter and bowled with a round-arm action, the batsman defends it towards the non striker
he stays on the back foot and punches the length delivery to deep point
pushed through outside off, Dhawan waits and chops it on to backward point
this one is slower on the middle stump line, the batsman tries to work it away to the leg side, but pushes it straight to square leg
he floats it full to the batsman, Rohit defends it to midwicket
he gets his front leg out of the way and drives it to deep extra cover for a single
he steps down the crease, but Maxwell slows the pace down, the batsman can only defend it back to the bowler
flatter delivery, it's punches to deep point for a single
now Rohit steps out of the crease but the length is still not there, he clips it to deep square leg for a single
he keeps it flatter outside off, Dhawan is not able to beat the backward point field again
he bowls it too full, provides Rohit the space to get under it and smack it over wide long on for a six
pulls the length back this time, the batsman is only able to defend to midwicket
slower still, the batsman dances down the pitch and punches it to deep midwicket
quicker delivery on the pads this time, Dhawan goes on the back foot and punches it to deep midwicket for a single
fires this one quicker, but loses direction as it's down the leg side
Rohit moves about in the crease, but that doesn't disturb the bowler who delivery a good delivery on off stump, the batsman has to play a drive to long off for a single
another full delivery on off, now Dhawan picks up a single to long off
he keeps it flat and around off stump, the batsman goes back and punches it to long on
again, beautifully being kept tight by Maxwell, this is on middle and leg and the batsman punches it to long off
some width this time, and Dhawan cuts it to deep point, but it's just a single
he gets to the pitch of the ball this time after using his feet, and once he gets there, he slogs it in the gap at deep midwicket, it's comfortably over the boundary
follows up the big shot with a forward defensive shot
gets some real distance on this shot now, as he steps out of the crease and launches this way over the long-off fielder for a huge hit
full and flighted on off, the batsman drives it to long on with a closed face of the bat
pushed through on a good length around off, the batsman comes forward and defends

and Rohit perishes in his attempt to catch up with the rate! Finch dragged this short, but it stopped a bit on the pitch, just enough, to mess up with Rohit's attempted pull shot. He aims for the stands at deep midwicket, but gets a toe-end of the bat and that settles easily into the lap of the fielder. Finally a breakthrough for Australia
full delivery outside off, the batsman drives it down the pitch, but Finch quickly moves to his right to cut it off
he steps out of the crease and drives this full delivery to long on this time
flatter delivery first up for Virat, who goes on the back foot and defends it to cover
fuller delivery on the pads, Dhawan wanted to paddle it fine, but gets hit on the pads. But that would have gone down the leg side with the angle
pushed through on the middle and leg line, Kohli dabs it towards square leg with soft hands and is quick to turn and call for a second
stays on the back foot and defends the length delivery back down the pitch
he tries to check Kohli's driving with a full delivery outside off and Kohli obliges by playing one of those whippy drives through extra cover
back to length for Maxwell and Kohli defends it to the leg side
he is quick to come out of the crease and he clips it to deep square leg, but there is no chance of a second as the fielder charges in
tossed up and full on the stumps, Kohli pushes it back to the bowler
looks to push this one towards cover, but gets the inside edge down the pitch
third dot ball as Kohli fails to beat Maxwell at cover with a powerful back foot punch
quicker delivery now, the batsman comes forward and defends
he steps out of the crease, gets to the pitch of the ball this time and creams it to the deep extra cover boundary
he floats it full on the pads this time, Kohli sweeps, but he hits it straight to fine leg
oh he steps out again and is not to the pitch, but still goes forward with his aimed inside out shot towards extra cover, it just goes over the fielder at short cover
goes on the back foot, and punches it to cover this time
he has clobbered that high and long, it's disappeared in the crowd at deep midwicket. That is some violent hit this one
the bowler was forced to shorten his length, but he makes the mistake of giving Kohli room. Instead of violence he chooses finesse, guiding it fine with a late cut
comes forward and drives the full delivery to long off for a single
full and flighted on leg stump, there is no room to get under, so Kohli drives it to long on for a single
131 kph, length ball which Kohli gets behind off straight away
133 kph, overpitched almost as Dhawan gets under it to flick square off the wicket on the leg side
135 kph, length ball going down the pads as Kohli simply helps this on its way to the fine leg boundary
136 kph, length ball which is pushed to long off for a single. Smart batting here from Kohli
134 kph, yorker on off as Dhawan is able to squeeze this out to the off side
134 kph, length ball going down the pads as Kohli clips this square on the leg side
125 kph, lovely cover drive, a signature shot for Kohli, as he powers this straight to cover
127 kph, length ball pushed to long on by Kohli. Sprinted straight away for the first, and turns to complete the second
128 kph, length ball on middle and leg which Kohli tucks away to the leg side for one
129 kph, Dhawan leans forward and gets his bat out to this wide delivery, finding the gap behind point and short third man all the way to the boundary. Fantastic release shot for India there.
126 kph, Opportunity lost there as Dhawan slaps this wide delivery straight at point
125 kph, brings this in closer and on a length as Dhawan looks to chop this behind square, but gets an inside edge which just beats the wicket. Third life for this silken cat.
Kohli leans into a drive which travels to long on for a single
135 kph, yorker on leg as Dhawan misses this completely and hits him flush on the foot. Faulkner goes up but this was going down the leg side. Ball ends up getting carried behind for four extra runs
135 kph, good length on off which Dhawan pushes to mid off

137 kph, Dhawan clips this fuller pitched delivery straight through midwicket. This sets off one of the more enthusiastic celebrations you will see as he drops his bat and then pumps both fists and then does a Afridi with his arms outstretched. This is his 4th ODI century.
133 kph, tries to cut away this back of a length delivery behind point but finds the fielder

136 kph, and its all over for Da-One. Looking to improvise a flick behind square on the leg side through fine leg, he ends up stepping out to the off side. Faulkner must have seen this coming as he releases the ball on a middle to leg stump line, which ends up castling the southpaw's wicket. So Dhawan was unable to make this century count for more, but still a fine effort considering the circumstances. Makes that the third century of the match as well.
127 kph, takes this back of a length ball and turns it away to the leg side
127 kph, Kohli waits on the back foot to cut this away in the gap between cover and point. Already 46 off 28 balls.
127 kph, length ball which Kohli pushes to long on for a single to get Raina on strike. Can Kohli make it four 50+ scores on the trot?
127 kph, McKay going round as he gets this to swing in outside off. Raina left quite a gap there, but is able to work this away to the leg side to get off the mark

129 kph, length ball angling in as Kohli clips it off the pads. Raina backed up too much though as he has to return to the non-strikers, just beating the throw from short mid on. End up running the overthrow anyways
128 kph, length ball angling in on middle as Raina is resolute in defence
136 kph, Kohli eases to his 27th ODI half-century with a flick behind square to the fine leg boundary. Jaipur Deja vu anyone?
133 kph, length ball outside off which Kohli drives beautifully on the up to long off
117 kph, slower ball and wide as Faulkner needs to find his radar, and quick. Kohli just slices this through the gap between point and cover to find yet another boundary. He is on fire!
138 kph, overpitched again as Kohli leans into a booming cover drive that just gets cut off by the fielder
137 kph, length ball just outside off as Faulkner goes round to accomodate Raina. Raina able to push this to backward point for a single
133 kph, length ball just outside off which Kohli gets behind off
140 kph, starts off wide a wide delivery down the leg side. A rather anti-climatic start, but Mitch certainly has the goods, especially on the subcontinent
142 kph, Raina gets on top of this one to tuck it away to the leg side for one
141 kph, fuller length wide of off stump as Kohli glides this behind point, but is unlucky to find the fielder
133 kph, slower ball (ahem, Indian bowlers pay attention) that Kohli sees early and gets forward to defend
146 kph, yorker length outside off which Kohli is unable to get a bat to as it carries through to the keeper
148 kph, Kohli able to angle this through midwicket for one
142 kph, short ball outside off as Raina goes for the pull shot, but is way too early for it, as it ends up carrying to the keeper. Raina looked out of his depth there that's for sure.
136 kph, length ball which Kohli pushes to the off side for one
134 kph, fuller pitched delivery on middle which Raina lofts over midwicket, and is lucky that the ball falls safely in no mans land
134 kph, length ball which Raina pushes to mid on. Finch, running in from there, picks it up and throws down the non-strikers, but Raina had dived in safely
137 kph, Kohli able to guide this length ball to the leg side for one

136 kph, Raina able to slap away this length ball on off stump through the gap on the off side for a boundary. Australian bowlers (and batsmen) must be wondering what they will need to score in order to trouble this Indian batting line-up?
138 kph, shortish delivery which Raina punches off the back foot, but finds mid off
145 kph, Kohli treats the crowd with an expansive drive through the covers, with the boundary rider able to rein it in
138 kph, Kohli just dismisses this short length delivery from his presence as he rocks back to pull him through midwicket for a boundary. Kohli looking very dangerous here
140 kph, Mitch drops it short and once again Kohli punishes him as he swivels on the back foot to pull this square off a rather 'finish' fine leg to just get to the boundary

149 kph, you know what they say, fortune favours the brave. Kohli, going for a slash over the covers, instead gets an outside edge which beats a diving Haddin to the third man boundary for the third consecutive four this over
148 kph, Kohli able to steer this wide delivery outside off behind square to third man for a single
143 kph, length ball on middle and leg which Raina negotiates safely away to the leg side
130 kph, Kohli trying to guide this behind short third man, but instead directs it straight to him
132 kph, Kohli gets forward to just push it past Watson on the left side of him
136 kph, Raina tries to get away this length ball outside off through the gap, but to no avail
133 kph, overpitched by Watson as Raina lofts this straight down the ground over long on to the rope
126 kph, shortish delivery which Raina think about cutting over the slip region, but unable to get bat on ball

136 kph, Raina gets on one knee to loft this sweetly through the covers, with Moises Henriques (sub) diving just before the rope to drag the ball back just before the boundary. Saved a certain two runs there
Johnson keeps it full and wide outside off, Kohli drives it to the left of cover where Finch dives and makes a half stop

138 kph, short ball again as Raina struggles to get this away with a pull. Doesn't seem to be a deflection, but the umpire has signalled he is out, which is not surprising for those in the know (Raina + short ball = trouble). Will need the replays to show if that he was indeed out as it is hard to say at the moment
149 kph, this one going down the leg side but Nigel Llong must be in good spirits as he hasn't called the wide
Johnson tests Yuvraj again with a short one, which Yuvraj looks somewhat hassled by as he covers the line

143 kph, it's all over, and that too quickly. Yuvraj plays all around this swinging delivery as he leaves a gap between bat and pad to get his off stump knocked back. Goes out for a three-ball duck, and suddenly this chase has taken on new meaning. Do we suspect a twist in the tail?
144 kph, speared in straight at middle as Dhoni covers the line
135 kph, length ball which Dhoni gets behind off without too much difficulty
136 kph, Dhoni steps down to clip this in front of square for one
135 kph, Kohli advances down the track to chip this through long on
138 kph, Dhoni flicks this behind square on the leg side and the pair run quickly enough to get back for the second
134 kph, back of a length on middle and leg which Dhoni guides to mid on
137 kph, this delivery drifts down the leg side as Kohli gets a bat on it to help it through the fine leg region for a boundary
152 kph, vicious delivery from Johnson as this tails back with Dhoni ducking under it. It was really fast too
144 kph, Dhoni decides his best option is to just allow this through to the keeper
147 kph, Dhoni gets his bat out to this fuller pitched delivery to carve this through third man for one
147 kph, Kohli looking to push this through the off side but instead the ball travels through third man off the bat
148 kph, Johnson slips in a shorter one which Dhoni gets back to just in time. Looks like these batsmen are content to see him off his spell
146 kph, Dhoni prods forward to angle this through point for a single and will retain the strike for the next over
135 kph, Dhoni gets forward to defend the ball
137 kph, length ball that just shapes away, beating the edge of Dhoni's bat
136 kph, this one slightly wider and shaping away as Dhoni is unable to get any meaningful connection
137 kph, and Dhoni is able to release some pressure with a thick edge that meant to go over cover, but instead travels square off the wicket for a boundary
138 kph, length ball again from Faulkner as Dhoni is unable to get any bat on it with the slightest of deviations away from the bat
138 kph, Dhoni gets forward and chips this full delivery over the bowler's head straight down the ground, with the pair completing two
144 kph, back of a length and Kohli lofts this on the up over extra-cover for a sweetly timed boundary. Outstanding shot!
138 kph, fires it short again as Kohli rocks back to try and pull through midwicket, but doesn't get a good connection on it
136 kph, shortish length again from Johnson as Kohli goes for the uppercut over the covers
144 kph, back of a length delivery angling in as Kohli guides this behind point to get off the strike
147 kph, fuller pitch and on middle and leg as Dhoni is able to chip this through the leg side
148 kph, back of a length delivery which Kohli negotiates with a glide through to third man
136 kph, Kohli seems to be out doing himself with every new shot as he slaps this short delivery over the covers for four. On 95 now
137 kph, length ball going to the leg side as Kohli covers the line carefully

136 kph, he is simply topping himself at each instance. Kohli uses his strong wrists to on drive this fuller length so sweelty, and generate so much power that it dissects the two boundary riders to the midwicket boundary

141 kph, take a bow Kohli. Is there a better man when it comes to chasing huge ODI totals? The crowd go bananas as Kohli glides this through third man for the third consecutive boundary of the over to bring up his 17th ODI hundred. Sterling stuff from this Indian batsman
length ball which Kohli plays to cover to get a single and get off the strike

137 kph, Dhoni able to turn this length ball away to midwicket, with the pair steaming through the first run to turn back and get the second. 15 off the over and just what the doctor ordered as far as India are concerned. Australia look a bit bedraggled on the field now.
133 kph, Kohli is simply taking this game away as he manufactures yet another sublime on drive between long on and midwicket which races so fast that it gets to the boundary without too much issue
120 kph, lovely slower ball which Kohli misses completely as the ball snakes onto his feet and bounces over to the off side, with the pair running the bye
121 kph, full and on middle as Dhoni is able to eke out two runs when the incoming throw hits the stumps and goes on to the leg side
119 kph, slower ball again as Dhoni is able to squirt this out to the off side
123 kph, Kohli was waiting for it, and Watson delivered it. Another slower ball and Kohli just hammers this over the midwicket boundary for four

136 kph, Kohli able to steer this square on the leg side and times it just right as the pair complete the first, and Kohli scampers back like an energized bunny to the other end, beating the incoming throw from the deep. This is scarcely believable stuff from the Indians! 350 chase made to look like a mockery!
the crowd jeers as this length ball just bypasses the off stump as Dhoni goes for the big swing

136 kph, low full toss outside off as Dhoni flashes hard and is able to pierce the gap between cover and backward point, with cover diving fully to his right in vain to try and stop this bullet off the bat

137 kph, Dhoni guides this through mid off, with mid off making a hash of it as it deflects towards long on, with the pair running the extra run to get the victory. It sets off delirious scenes from the Nagpur crowd as they roar in approval to what has been a sublime batting performance from the young turks of Indian cricket.
